channel.title: Game Rant - Platforms
channel.description: Platforms refer to the different consoles and distribution services that players can use to play video games.

item.title: The First Descendant Reveals Season 3 Update and NieR: Automata Collab
item.dc:creator: Jo Craig
item.description: During a panel at PAX East 2025, The First Descendant producer Beomjun Lee announces the looter shooter’s Season 3 update and NieR: Automata collab.
item.content:encoded: The First Descendant has announced its brand-new Season 3 update in tandem with a NieR: Automata collaboration reveal. The details were given at PAX East 2025, known as a collection of gaming culture festivals held annually in Seattle, Boston, Philadelphia, and Melbourne, during a panel with The First Descendant producer Beomjun Lee.

item.title: Roblox: Swordify Codes
item.dc:creator: Artur Novichenko
item.description: In this guide, Roblox players can find all of the redeemable codes for Swordify. Hurry up and use them before it's too late.
item.content:encoded: In this game, players will have to fight waves of enemies and unlock new worlds. But of course, at first, your character will be quite weak. And to increase their stats, you will have to train a lot. Fortunately, with the help of Swordify codes you will speed up your progress significantly.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Player Discovers a Major Change to Sneaking
item.dc:creator: Matthew O’Dwyer
item.category: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered
item.description: One person playing The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered discovers that a major change has been made to the way Sneaking functions in the RPG.
item.content:encoded: One player discovered that The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered made a major change to the way Sneaking functions, surprising fans of the original game. The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered was shadow dropped by Bethesda on April 22 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, with rumors that it could be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 at some point in the future.

item.title: Leaked Image Shows Elden Ring's Map One Year Before Release
item.dc:creator: Jo Craig
item.description: An Elden Ring fan shares a leaked image with the soulslike community showing what the Lands Between looked like one year before the game released.
item.content:encoded: An Elden Ring fan has uncovered a hidden gem for the soulslike community, sharing a previously leaked image unveiling the game’s original map one year before its release. Elden Ring was first launched in 2022 and easily went on to become Game of the Year. Crafted to perfection by Hidetaka Miyazaki and Game of Thrones worldbuilder George R. R. Martin, the action RPG sees players take control of the customizable Tarnished, who enters into a quest to restore the titular law of the world and become the new Elden Lord.

item.title: How Monster Hunter's Hunting Horn Has Evolved Throughout the Series
item.dc:creator: Chris Nicholls
item.description: The Hunting Horn has been one of Monster Hunter's staple items since early in the series, and as it has evolved, it has become a fan favorite.
item.content:encoded: The Monster Hunter series gives players a wide range of weapons to play with, allowing them to choose which tool to use to take down the game’s giant creatures. While the franchise has introduced new weapons overtime and replaced others, one of Monster Hunter’s mainstays is the Hunting Horn.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Can Kill Two Birds With One Stone
item.dc:creator: Enricko Ozoa
item.description: When it comes to an idea that provides two things people are looking for in Helldivers 2, there is one that Arrowhead Studios could consider.
item.content:encoded: Every time Helldivers 2 announces plans for an update, players immediately speculate as to what will come to the game next. This is because its developer, Arrowhead Game Studios, is known for unpredictability, ensuring any patch can bring something nobody would expect. However, excitement and anticipation won't be enough to keep players around long-term, as the content itself has to be worthwhile. One example of worthwhile content would be something brand-new for Helldivers 2, and it's a tool that gives players two things that they've requested for a long time.

item.title: Dead By Daylight's New Quest System is One Step Forward, Two Steps Back
item.dc:creator: Devin Friend
item.description: Dead by Daylight's new quest system incorporates some good ideas, but it also raises a few good questions about the game's future.
item.content:encoded: Dead by Daylight's new quest system makes a big stride forward, but also stumbles when it comes to a few key areas. Dead by Daylight just saw one of the biggest overhauls in its existence so far, with many elements getting a fresh coat of paint. The biggest example is the game's longstanding Rift, which has seen almost a complete rework. There are a few definite improvements that should be noted, but at the same time, not all the changes were perfect. In particular, the quest system in Dead by Daylight may take time for some fans to get used to.

item.title: After Saros, One PlayStation Release Feels Inevitable
item.dc:creator: LB Beistad
item.description: Saros is the next game from developer Housemarque, and the arrival of the mysterious sci-fi story may pave the way for a new release.
item.content:encoded: Saros is the next roguelike project from developer Housemarque, and it's already shaping up to have a compelling premise. As the creators of Returnal, Housemarque demonstrated with its last game just how effective roguelike gameplay can be as a storytelling tool. Saros promises a similar approach, but it's bound to have its own unique approaches to its story and mechanics.

item.title: Clair Obscur Makes a Case for Kingdom Hearts to Add Non-Square Enix RPGs
item.dc:creator: Enricko Ozoa
item.description: If Kingdom Hearts ever needed a reason to include games other than those of Square Enix RPGs, then Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 would be the best one.
item.content:encoded: The premise of the Kingdom Hearts franchise is one that was meant for the worlds of Disney and Square Enix RPGs to co-exist, resulting in the creation of games that blend the popular movies of the former with the gameplay and themes of the latter. It also led to the characters of the two living in the same universe, leading to interesting interactions and a unique narrative that's as entertaining as it is complex. However, one has to wonder if Kingdom Hearts will go beyond Square Enix when it comes to introducing different entities and aspects of RPGs, especially since the recent entry made it seem that it may be time to do so. If the franchise needed a reason to push through with such a decision, then it only has to look at the success of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33.

item.title: Prey 2 May Never Happen, But Judas Could Be the Next Best Thing
item.dc:creator: Ediz Guner
item.description: Although a sequel to Arkane's Prey will probably never see the light of day, there is at least one upcoming game that may fill its place.
item.content:encoded: In 2016, Bethesda Softworks announced that Arkane Studios, the company behind the Dishonored series, was working on a reboot of the 2006 video game Prey. This new game, which was also titled Prey, had very little in common with the Human Head Studios-developed FPS, aside from sharing the same name and featuring aliens in some capacity. It, in fact, was intended to be a spiritual successor to the System Shock franchise rather than a true Prey follow-up. Nonetheless, the game was marketed as a reboot of 2006's Prey due to corporate decisions from Bethesda higher-ups.
